intro: Scurrula philippensis, commonly known as the Philippine scurrula, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
